item.description:
Who wants to Pig Out? Well if you do, this is your chance. This meal has also been posted as a Breakfast, Bunch, Lunch and Dinner group meetup.

Citizen's Public House just added a Family Style Pig Roast to their brunch menu. The meal starts with various assorted shellfish, such as: fresh oysters, little neck clams, and cocktail shrimp. Then shortly after, the guest of honor, a Whole Suckling Pig,which has been slowly roasted for 14 hours is served with sides such as Brussels Sprouts, Broccoli Gratin, Whipped Yukon Gold Potatoes (sides will vary depending on what’s fresh and in season).

Everyone's cost is $38 per person however beverage, tax and tip are NOT included in this price so figure a total cost of about $55.

You do NOT need to pay a deposit and are able to include a guest if you have a good RSVP history. However, if you have a poor RSVP history you MUST pay a $38 per person deposit for you and any guest, which is refundable based on Citizen's cancellation policy.

Check out MBTA or Hop Stop to create your route by public transit. Citizen's is a ten minute walk from Fenway (green line) or Kenmore station (green line).

There should be plenty of FREE parking at the meters along Boylston Street.

PARKING VALIDATION AT 1330 BOYLSTON GARAGE .... ENTRANCE ON JERSEY STREET $4 FOR UP TO 3 HOURS ... AFTER 3 HOURS YOU MUST PAY FULL PRICE
-------------------------------------------------------
Below, I have listed the Reservation Rules

Please understand the NO-SHOW policy was established to ensure everyone who wants to join can and it will be fairly and strictly enforced.

I had to provide my credit card for this reservation and will be charged for each cancellation which is less than 72 hours from the reservation. You MUST be certain you can attend.

Rules for Events with Reservations:

If it is less than 72 hours from the meal and you are not able to attend because of an emergency (and NOT because you have a better offer) or you are running late on the day of the brunch, you MUST call or text me at (617) 445-7549.

Please be considerate of your fellow diners time by arriving promptly.

Please bring enough cash to pay for your meal, drinks, tip, and tax.

All RSVPs are on a first reply, first seated basis.

You may only RSVP YES or NO. Maybe isn't an option.

Please RSVP YES only if you are certain you will attend.

If you're not sure you can attend because you have other unconfirmed plans or uncertain transportation, please RSVP NO with a comment.

If the meal is full and you wish to attend, please select WAIT LIST RSVP. When a spot opens, your RSVP will be changed to YES based on the time of your WAIT LIST RSVP and if you answered the RSVP question.

If your name appears on the event page as a YES after the meal and you have not attended nor contacted me, you will be REMOVED and BANNED from Happy Hour.

If I change your RSVP to NO because you haven't replied to final update meal confirmation email deadline, it is counted as a NO-SHOW.

If you change your RSVP from a YES to a NO within 72 hours of the reservation, it is counted as a NO-SHOW if you do not contact me.

If you are a NO-SHOW for this meal you are removed from the group.

NO-SHOWS impact everyone; from you, who could or has been on the wait list to the organizer as well as the restaurant's who staff based on our reservation.

An email from you explaining your absence is an expected courtesy.

If you are removed and there were extenuating circumstances, please email Tonya about rejoining.

Your feedback is appreciated so please, rate the event and venue by completing surveys afterward.

I will arrive at 12:30 PM to welcome you from the Citizen's bar.
item.name: Pig Roast Brunch at Citizen's Bar on Sunday March 11th
